column4: What does one do, if one wants to contribute to Linux/Ubuntu with driver-development ...in this particular case USB scanner-drivers for SANE ?
i'm just guessing but you might want to find the SANE website or see if they have a project on Launchpad
I have found this in Launchpad --> https://launchpad.net/sane-backends

...they talk of an API, which sounds VERY interesting.  I just wish there were more details outthere on the web about how to create USB drivers in Linux for hardware that is not supported but you own....so you might be able to get reverse-enginering data from.
i might be able to help you understand the process to reverse engineer something like this.
first, you need a way to get the USB data. You mentioned a windows tool, you will need this. I am looking for a way to do this on linux now
it appears that wireshark can capture USB data
to tool I was reffered to was this one --> http://www.wingmanteam.com/usbsnoopy/

so, depending on how much you can understand about the protocol that is used (wireshark should help with that) you can move between windows and linux coding as you go if you don't understand something or doing a lot at once
yes, but If the data was already in Linux then there wouldn't be a problem ;-) .... to see the device work proberly it will have to go the MS Windows, right ?
yes, but it always helps to have a cross-platform alternative
does Wireshark run in MS Windows ?
AAAAAHHHH...very cool ...I didn't now that ... then of course that would be the better choice
I think you understand the process from there. Of course, you will need to find a way to read/write usb data in your language
